guidance_for_write_dockerfile_agent:
The Dockerfile failed to build because the 'pip' command was not found. This is a common issue on Ubuntu 18.04 where 'python3-pip' provides 'pip3' but not necessarily a 'pip' symlink. Update the Dockerfile to use 'pip3' instead of 'pip' for installing Python packages. 

Specifically, change this line:
FROM --platform=linux/x86_64 ubuntu:18.04
ARG DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV TZ=Etc/UTC

# System dependencies installation. Installs essential tools and libraries required for development and runtime
RUN apt update && apt install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    python3 \
    python3-pip \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Python packages required for the build system (e.g., Conan)
RUN pip install \
    conan \
    conan-package-tools

To:
FROM --platform=linux/x86_64 ubuntu:18.04
ARG DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV TZ=Etc/UTC

# System dependencies installation. Installs essential tools and libraries required for development and runtime
RUN apt update && apt install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    python3 \
    python3-pip \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Python packages required for the build system (e.g., Conan)
RUN pip3 install \
    conan \
    conan-package-tools
